def _convert_listlike_datetimes(
    arg,
    box,
    format,
    name=None,
    tz=None,
    unit=None,
    errors=None,
    infer_datetime_format=None,
    dayfirst=None,
    yearfirst=None,
    exact=None,
):
    from pandas import DatetimeIndex
    from pandas.core.arrays import DatetimeArray
    from pandas.core.arrays.datetimes import objects_to_datetime64ns

    # existing code...

    if tz is not None and tz.lower() == "utc":
        utc = True  # Set a flag to indicate UTC conversion should be applied
    else:
        utc = False

    # existing code...

    if utc:
        result, tz_parsed = objects_to_datetime64ns(
            arg,
            dayfirst=dayfirst,
            yearfirst=yearfirst,
            utc=utc,
            errors=errors,
            require_iso8601=require_iso8601,
            allow_object=True,
        )

        result = DatetimeIndex._simple_new(result, name=name, tz="UTC") if box else result
    else:
        result, tz_parsed = objects_to_datetime64ns(
            arg,
            dayfirst=dayfirst,
            yearfirst=yearfirst,
            utc=utc,
            errors=errors,
            require_iso8601=require_iso8601,
            allow_object=True,
        )

    # existing code...

    return result
